title: Gumbs on Tubman at Combahee - identifying claim

content.question: Which of the following claims is best supported by the source?

choices.label: Harriet Tubman’s actions in the Combahee River uprising served as an inspiration for Nat Turner and Denmark Vesey’s rebellions.
Harriet Tubman participated in the Combahee River uprising primarily by providing advice to Union Army commanders.
Harriet Tubman’s leadership in the Combahee River raid significantly influenced the overall outcome of the Civil War.
Harriet Tubman’s role as a conductor of the Underground Railroad was more important than her role in the Combahee River uprising.

content.answer: Harriet Tubman’s leadership in the Combahee River raid significantly influenced the overall outcome of the Civil War.

topic.text: 2.20: Race to the Promised Land: Abolitionism and the Underground Railroad
